metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9720 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: Tornado before 3.2.2 sends arbitrary responses that contain a fixed CSRF token and may be sent with HTTP compression, which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct a BREACH attack and determine this token via a series of crafted requests.

criterions.comment: python-tornado: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
